column1: Arnaut Danjuma Groeneveld (born 31 January 1997) is a professional  who plays as a  for  club , on loan from . Born in Nigeria, he played for the , most recently in 2022.
After making one  appearance for  in the , he played for  in the  and Eerste Divisie,  in the  and  in the  and . He signed for Villarreal for an estimated €25 million in 2021.
Born in Nigeria and raised mainly in the Netherlands, Danjuma earned his first  for the  in October 2018. He was recalled to the team three years later.

Danjuma was born in , Nigeria to a Dutch father and a Nigerian mother. After his parents' divorce, he was briefly homeless and spent time in . He joined  in 2008 from ; he made his professional debut for  in the  on 7 December 2015 against , replacing  after 65 minutes of a 3–0 home loss.

In the summer of 2016, Danjuma signed for  where he was expected to play for the second team. On 10 September, he made his debut and first  appearance against his former club PSV; he was an 85th-minute substitute for  in a 4–0 home loss. In 16 appearances in his first season, he scored once to open a 2–0 win at  on the final day of the season; the team were relegated through the playoffs.

In July 2018, Danjuma signed for . He made his debut on 22 July in the , helping his team to a 2–1 win over . On 3 October, he scored a goal against  in a 3–1 loss in the  group stage. In his only full season in the , he scored five goals, starting with two in a 3–0 home win over  on 10 August.

On 1 August 2019, Danjuma joined  club  for a fee of £13.7 million, signing a long-term contract. He made his debut against  in the third round of the  on 25 September, as a 61st-minute substitute for  in a 2–0 away loss; his first goal was in a 3–2 win against  on 12 September 2020.

After ten goal contributions in a month, Danjuma was awarded the  award for April 2021. He was awarded the Bournemouth Player of the Year award after receiving 40% of the supporters' vote, narrowly beating  who had 38% of the vote.

On 19 August 2021, Danjuma joined  club  for a fee believed to be in the region of €25 million, signing a contract until June 2026. He scored his first goal for the club in a 1–1 draw with reigning league champions  on 29 August, and his first  goal in a 2–2 draw against  on 14 September. On 19 February 2022, he scored a hat-trick in a 4–1 league victory over ; two months later he contributed both goals of a home win against  .

Danjuma scored six Champions League goals in his first season at Villarreal. His brace in a 3–2 win at Atalanta on 9 December put the team into the last 16 as group runners-up. On 6 April 2022, he scored the only goal against  at the  in the quarter-finals first leg; he missed the second leg of the semi-final elimination by  through a muscle injury.

During January 2023, Danjuma was set to return to England to join , before  hijacked the deal. On 25 January 2023, he joined Tottenham on loan until the end of the season. Three days later Danjuma was added to the squad as a substitute for the  game. He came off the bench marking his debut and scored a goal in the 3–0 victory away against . He scored his first Premier League goal on 15 April 2023 in a 3–2 home defeat by  Bournemouth. Tottenham confirmed the end of Danjuma's loan spell on 15 June 2023.

On 23 July 2023, Danjuma joined  on a season-long loan from , taking the number 10 shirt. He made his first appearance against  in a pre-season friendly on 29 July, playing 45 minutes before being substituted in a 1-0 away win. Danjuma made his debut in a 1–0 league defeat against  at .
On 30 August 2024, Danjuma was loaned to fellow  club  on a season-long loan.

Danjuma was born in Nigeria to a Dutch father and Nigerian mother, and was eligible for either national team. He was first called up for the  by  in October 2018. He made his debut on 13 October in a 3–0  home win over , as a 68th-minute substitute for former Jong PSV teammate . Three days later, he scored his first international goal to equalise in a 1–1 friendly draw away to neighbours .

After nearly three years without a cap, Danjuma returned to the squad as a replacement for . On 11 October 2021 in a  qualifier at home to , he came off the bench and scored in a 6–0 win.  did not call him up for the final tournament in Qatar.

Arnaut and Danjuma are the player's first names, with him describing the latter as his Nigerian name; he also uses Adam as his Muslim name. He was raised Muslim but stated that he did not become a practising Muslim until he was an adult; he celebrates goals by saying the .
